channel.title: Is it possible to add a tab to the options dialog?
channel.description:
[b]Aye, I think I found something:[/b]
[url='https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Making_GameUI_Panels']VGUI2: Creating a panel - developer.valvesoftware.com[/url]
As of now, my C++ knowledge is close to zero, since I have been experimenting with C# in the past years, only....
If there is any way to just add a page / tab to the existing panel, I'd be more than happy to know about it. :slight_smile:
If there is no other way than using C++, I think I have to drop this idea (again). :frowning:
Thanks in advance!
[b]EDIT (09:13 PM):[/b] I've also tried to somehow "squeeze" the controls I wanted to add into the existing "Black Mesa" tab, but there's just not enough space left for 4 Labels and 3 Sliders...
[b][i]Original thread text:[/i][/b]
[COLOR='#808080']Good afternoon,
while browsing through some of the mod files I came to think about adding a new options tab to the in-game (options) menu itself (similiar to how the DEV-Team added their "Black Mesa" tab).
I did figure out how to add and change certain sliders and labels to said "Black Mesa" tab and to make them actually do something, but I can't seem to figure out how to "duplicate" said Black Mesa options tab - so I can edit this duplicated tab.
There is an [url='https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Adding_convars_to_the_multiplayer_advanced_tab']article in VALVe's developer wiki[/url] I found.
It describes how to add controls for different ConVars.
What I am trying to do, is add a new tab for different controls (checkboxes, sliders, etc.) entirely (as illustrated in the image below).
[img]https://imageshack.us/a/img713/6290/duplicatedtab.png[/img]
[b]Note:[/b] The above image shows, what I'm trying to accomplish (not entirely, but it would be a start).
Is there a way to do this?
Any help would be much appreciated!
[b]Note 2:[/b] This may be the wrong subforum (I think it is), so if it is, please move this thread. I'd like to say sorry in advance, if that is the case. :wink: [/SIZE]
